content: A man lives on the 10th floor of a building. Every day he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to leave the building. When he returns, he always takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor. Why does he do this?

But when he comes back, he takes the elevator only up to the 7th floor and then walks up to the 10th floor using the stairs. The question is why he does this.

Maybe the elevator is out of order between the 7th and 10th floors, but again, if that were the case, he wouldn't be able to go down to the ground floor either, assuming the elevator is the same one for both directions.
